intro: Baeothryon variegatum, commonly known as the variegated baeothryon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Baeothryon variegatum is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to varying environmental conditions.
